Package org.example.utility.api.email

Class EmailUtil

java.lang.Object
org.example.utility.api.email.EmailUtil
public class EmailUtil extends Object
The `EmailUtil` class provides utility methods for validating email addresses and checking email registrations. It includes functionality for verifying the email format and checking whether the email is registered in the system.

  • Constructor Details

    • EmailUtil

      public EmailUtil()

  • Method Details

    • checkEmailAddress

      public static boolean checkEmailAddress(String input)
      Checks if the provided input contains a valid email address with specific domains. The supported domains are: gmail, yahoo, hotmail, outlook, and ocdsb.
      Parameters:
      input - The string to be checked for a valid email address.
      Returns:
      `true` if the input contains a valid email address with the specified domains, otherwise `false`.

    • emailRegistered

      public static boolean emailRegistered(String emailAddress)
      Checks if an email address is registered in the system. This method compares the provided email address against a list of registered users and returns `true` if a matching email address is found.
      Parameters:
      emailAddress - The email address to be checked.
      Returns:
      `true` if the email is registered, otherwise `false`.

    • getUsernameWithEmail

      public static String getUsernameWithEmail(String emailAddress)
      Retrieves the username associated with the provided email address. If the email address exists in the system, this method returns the corresponding username; otherwise, it returns an empty string.
      Parameters:
      emailAddress - The email address for which to retrieve the username.
      Returns:
      The username associated with the email address, or an empty string if no match is found.
